block.p: Hannah Parker Stebbins, the daughter of Pamela and Richard Stebbins of New York, was married yesterday in New Marlborough, Mass., to Jeffrey Jason Resetarits, a son of Joan and Ronald Resetarits of Buffalo. The Rev. Dr. Edward Ingebretsen, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the nondenominational ceremony at the New Marlborough Meeting House.

Ms. Stebbins, 30, is keeping her name. She was until last month an associate for public education on air pollution at the Environmental Health Coalition in San Diego. She graduated from Trinity College in Hartford and received a master's degree in environmental science from the University of Montana. Her father retired as a vice president for sales and marketing in New York for WestPoint Stevens, the home furnishings manufacturer. Her mother is a grants administrator at St. James' Church in New York.

Hannah Parker Stebbins, the daughter of Pamela and Richard Stebbins of New York, was married yesterday in New Marlborough, Mass., to Jeffrey Jason Resetarits, a son of Joan and Ronald Resetarits of Buffalo. The Rev. Dr. Edward Ingebretsen, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the nondenominational ceremony at the New Marlborough Meeting House.

Ms. Stebbins, 30, is keeping her name. She was until last month an associate for public education on air pollution at the Environmental Health Coalition in San Diego. She graduated from Trinity College in Hartford and received a master's degree in environmental science from the University of Montana. Her father retired as a vice president for sales and marketing in New York for WestPoint Stevens, the home furnishings manufacturer. Her mother is a grants administrator at St. James' Church in New York.

Mr. Resetarits, 31, was until last month a law clerk for Judge J. Warren Ferguson of the Federal Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, in Santa Ana, Calif. In November, he is to become a trial lawyer in the Civil Rights Division of the Justice Department in Washington. He graduated from Georgetown University and received a J.D. from Northeastern University. His mother is the chairwoman of the business-education department at Williamsville South High School in Williamsville, N.Y. His father owns the Resetarits Company, a machine tools distributor in Williamsville.
